EmailTemplate.name: 201710_TFETechSupport_LG.201710_TFETechSupport_LG
EmailTemplate.subject: Tech Tips - Improve oil pressure and prevent static oil leaks on TFE731 engines
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/]]>
Are you experiencing reduced oil pressure or static oil leaks on a TFE731-2/3/4/5 engine?
Because of the installed angle of some right-hand engine installations and an oil drain-back issue using a previous part, it's possible that oil can be observed leaking from the No. 6 carbon seal area and/or the accessory gearbox breather pressurizing valve.
If this happens, Service Bulletin TFE731-79-3064 <[[https://myaerospace.honeywell.com/search#q=TFE731-79-3064&sort=relevancy]]>recommends that you replace oil lube pump part number 3060785-3 with 3071949-12. This service bulletin may be used instead of TFE731-79-3059 or TFE731-79-3066 (as applicable) to prevent static oil leaks at the No. 6 bearing/seal cavity.
Static oil leaks are not a grounding item and Honeywell recommends that this service bulletin be implemented during the next scheduled oil pump removal.
Please refer to the MyAerospace Portal <[[https://myaerospace.honeywell.com/services-and-support/support/technical-support]]> for the latest technical information, including Service Bulletin TFE731-79-3064.
Still need help? Please visit our MyAerospace Technical Knowledge Center <[[https://myaerospace.honeywell.com/services-and-support/support/technical-support]]> for troubleshooting articles, technical publications, or to submit questions to our technical support engineering team.
Visit MyAerospace <[[https://myaerospace.honeywell.com/]]>
